Metadata.Title: Protect Your Out-of-Process State Service
Metadata.Priority: J.D. Meier, Alex Mackman, Blaine Wastell, Prashant Bansode, Andy Wigley, Kishore Gopalan

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • ASP.NET 2.0

What to Do

Protect Your Out-of-Process State Service.

When

If you use mode=StateServer on the <SESSIONSTATE>element, use the following recommendations.

How

These are the specific recommendations for securing session state:

  • Use a least-privileged account to run the state service. By default, the state service runs using the Network Service local, least-privileged account. You should not need to change this configuration
  • Protect the session state communication channel. (see the related guideline that follows for more information)
  • Consider changing the default port. (see the related guideline that follows for more information)
  • Encrypt the state connection string.

Adapted from Microsoft patterns & practices guidance.
